intro: Hieracium subobscurans, commonly known as the pale hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as meadows and roadsides. It produces yellow flowers that bloom in the summer, and its leaves are usually hairy and alternate along the stem. Hieracium subobscurans is often found in moist or sandy soils and can form dense colonies in suitable environments.
